logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: I contain multitudes

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Microbes, most of them bacteria, have populated this planet since long before animal life developed...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã 'sinh sống/định cư' (populated) 'trên hành tinh' (this planet) này

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To live in an area and form its population
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đã sinh sống trên hành tinh này

phase3Production.content: Dinosaurs populated this planet for millions of years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and they will outlive us.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To live longer than someone else

phase3Production.content: Due to their resilience, it is said that cockroaches will outlive us all.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Invisible to the naked eye, they are ubiquitous.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Unable to be seen without the use of a microscope or other special instrument

phase3Production.content: Most bacteria are invisible to the naked eye.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Invisible to the naked eye, they are ubiquitous.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có mặt ở khắp mọi nơi, phổ biến

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Present, appearing, or found everywhere
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phổ biến, có mặt ở khắp nơi

phase3Production.content: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: And, as Yong explains in his utterly absorbing and hugely important book, we mess with them at our peril.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Extremely interesting and engaging

phase3Production.content: I found the documentary to be utterly absorbing from start to finish.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we mess with them at our peril.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Gây rối với chúng và 'tự gánh lấy rủi ro' (at our peril)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning that doing something is dangerous and could result in harm or problems for oneself

phase3Production.content: You can ignore the doctor's advice, but you do so at your peril.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Every species has its own colony of microbes, called a ‘microbiome’...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A community of microorganisms living together

phase3Production.content: The scientist grew a colony of microbes in the petri dish.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Indeed, some scientists even suggest we should think of each species and its microbes as a single unit, dubbed a ‘holobiont’.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: As one complete and whole entity

phase3Production.content: The team worked together as a single unit to complete the project.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as a single unit, dubbed a ‘holobiont’.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be given a particular name or nickname

phase3Production.content: Because of his speed, the runner was dubbed 'The Flash' by his teammates.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: So ‘bad’ microbes are just microbes out of context.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Vi khuẩn 'không đúng ngữ cảnh/sai chỗ' (out of context)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Microbes that are in the wrong place in the body, where they can cause harm

phase3Production.content: A beneficial gut bacterium can become a 'bad' microbe if it gets into the lungs; it's a microbe out of context.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Microbes that sit contentedly in the human gut... can become deadly if they find their way into the bloodstream.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To exist or reside in a place in a happy and satisfied way
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cư ngụ một cách yên ổn

phase3Production.content: The cat sat contentedly on the sunny windowsill.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: find their way into the bloodstream
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...can become deadly if they find their way into the bloodstream.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nếu chúng 'tìm được đường vào' (find their way into) 'mạch máu' (the bloodstream)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To manage to enter the system of blood vessels in a body

phase3Production.content: The infection becomes serious if the bacteria find their way into the bloodstream.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we are continually swapping microbes with other humans, pets and the world at large.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To exchange microorganisms with others

phase3Production.content: Every time we shake hands, we are swapping microbes with another person.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It’s a fascinating topic and Yong, a young British science journalist, is an extraordinarily adept guide.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'người hướng dẫn' (guide) 'cực kỳ' (extraordinarily) 'tinh thông/khéo léo' (adept)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An exceptionally skilled and proficient person who leads or shows the way
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Người hướng dẫn cực kỳ tài ba

phase3Production.content: Our tour leader was an extraordinarily adept guide to the ancient ruins.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...he has a knack of explaining complex science in terms that are both easy to understand and totally enthralling.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have a special talent or ability for explaining things

phase3Production.content: She has a knack of explaining difficult concepts in a simple way.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in terms that are both easy to understand and totally enthralling.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Completely capturing and holding one's attention; fascinating

phase3Production.content: The performance was totally enthralling; the audience was silent throughout.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Yong is on a mission.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đang 'thực hiện một sứ mệnh' (on a mission)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be very determined to achieve a particular goal
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đang thực hiện một sứ mệnh

phase3Production.content: She's on a mission to improve literacy rates in her community.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: in a bid to persuade us
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a bizarre, alien planet – in a bid to persuade us to love them as much as he does.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Trong một nỗ lực' (in a bid to) 'thuyết phục chúng ta' (persuade us)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In an attempt to convince us
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong nỗ lực thuyết phục chúng ta

phase3Production.content: The company lowered its prices in a bid to attract more customers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The first man to see these extraordinarily potent creatures was a Dutch lens-maker...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Organisms that have great power, influence, or effect

phase3Production.content: Even small amounts of the venom from these potent creatures can be deadly.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...he examined a drop of water from a nearby lake and found it teeming with tiny creatures he called ‘animalcules’.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thấy nó 'đầy rẫy/chi chít' (teeming with) những sinh vật nhỏ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be full of or swarming with

phase3Production.content: The pond was teeming with fish and other aquatic life.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It was Pasteur’s ‘germ theory’ that gave bacteria the poor image that endures today.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The theory that certain diseases are caused by the invasion of the body by microorganisms

phase3Production.content: The development of the germ theory revolutionized medicine.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the poor image that endures today.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hình ảnh tồi tệ 'còn tồn tại/kéo dài' (endures) 'đến ngày nay' (today)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To continue to exist or last to the present day

phase3Production.content: His legacy as a great leader endures today.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Yong’s book is in many ways a plea for microbial tolerance...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'lời kêu gọi/khẩn cầu' (a plea for) 'sự khoan dung' (tolerance) 'với vi sinh vật' (microbial)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An urgent and emotional request to be more accepting of microbes
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một lời kêu gọi cho sự khoan dung với vi sinh vật

phase3Production.content: The documentary is a plea for greater understanding and tolerance of different cultures.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...many thousands more play a vital role in maintaining our health.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đóng một vai trò' (play a role) 'sống còn/thiết yếu' (vital) 'trong' (in)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have a very important and necessary function in a particular process or situation
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đóng một vai trò sống còn trong

phase3Production.content: Vitamins play a vital role in maintaining good health.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: We tend to see the dangers posed by bacteria, yet at the same time we are sold yoghurts...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'nguy hiểm' (dangers) 'gây ra bởi' (posed by) 'vi khuẩn' (bacteria)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The risks or threats that are caused or created by bacteria
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những nguy hiểm do vi khuẩn gây ra

phase3Production.content: The article discusses the dangers posed by online misinformation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we are sold yoghurts and drinks that supposedly nurture ‘friendly’ bacteria.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To help or encourage the growth and development of beneficial bacteria

phase3Production.content: Probiotic foods are designed to nurture friendly bacteria in your gut.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Instead we should realise we have a symbiotic relationship, that can be mutually beneficial or mutually destructive.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Allies or enemies

phase3Production.content: In politics, it can be difficult to tell who are friends or foes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Instead we should realise we have a symbiotic relationship...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A relationship between two different organisms that live together and depend on each other

phase3Production.content: The clownfish and the sea anemone have a classic symbiotic relationship.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that can be mutually beneficial or mutually destructive.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Beneficial to both parties involved

phase3Production.content: The trade agreement was mutually beneficial for both countries.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that can be mutually beneficial or mutually destructive.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Causing destruction to both parties involved

phase3Production.content: An all-out nuclear war would be mutually destructive for all nations.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: New research is now unravelling the ways in which bacteria aid digestion...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Investigating and explaining the methods by which something works
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm sáng tỏ những cách thức

phase3Production.content: Scientists are still unravelling the ways in which the human brain works.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...bacteria aid digestion, regulate our immune systems, eliminate toxins...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To help the process of breaking down food in the body

phase3Production.content: Enzymes in saliva help to aid digestion from the moment you start eating.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...regulate our immune systems, eliminate toxins, produce vitamins...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Điều hòa' (regulate) 'hệ miễn dịch' (immune systems) 'của chúng ta' (our)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To control the body's system for fighting off disease
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Điều hòa hệ miễn dịch của chúng ta

phase3Production.content: A healthy lifestyle is important to regulate our immune systems effectively.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...eliminate toxins, produce vitamins, affect our behaviour and even combat obesity.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To remove poisonous substances from the body

phase3Production.content: The liver plays a key role to eliminate toxins from the blood.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...affect our behaviour and even combat obesity.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To fight against the condition of being grossly overweight

phase3Production.content: Public health campaigns are designed to combat obesity in children.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Our obsession with hygiene, our overuse of antibiotics and our unhealthy, low-fibre diets are disrupting the bacterial balance...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To disturb the healthy equilibrium of bacteria in a system (like the gut)
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phá vỡ sự cân bằng vi khuẩn

phase3Production.content: Taking too many antibiotics can end up disrupting the bacterial balance in your intestines.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...may be responsible for soaring rates of allergies and immune problems...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Rapidly increasing numbers of cases of allergies
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tỷ lệ dị ứng tăng vọt

phase3Production.content: Doctors are concerned about the soaring rates of childhood asthma.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The most recent research actually turns accepted norms upside down.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đảo lộn' (turns upside down) 'các chuẩn mực' (norms) 'được chấp nhận' (accepted)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To completely change or reverse things that are considered standard or normal
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đảo lộn các chuẩn mực được chấp nhận

phase3Production.content: The internet has turned the accepted norms of communication upside down.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...there are studies indicating that the excessive use of household detergents and antibacterial products actually destroys the microbes...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The use of something in a quantity or degree that is more than is necessary, normal, or desirable

phase3Production.content: The excessive use of pesticides can harm the environment.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: keep the more dangerous germs at bay
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...destroys the microbes that normally keep the more dangerous germs at bay.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Giữ cho' (keep) 'những mầm bệnh' (germs) 'nguy hiểm hơn' (more dangerous) 'không đến gần' (at bay)

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /kiːp ðə mɔː ˈdeɪndʒərəs dʒɜːmz ət beɪ/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To prevent harmful microorganisms from approaching or having an effect
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giữ cho các mầm bệnh nguy hiểm hơn không đến gần

phase3Production.content: A strong immune system helps to keep dangerous germs at bay.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Other studies show that keeping a dog as a pet gives children early exposure to a diverse range of bacteria...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The state of being in contact with something at a young age

phase3Production.content: Early exposure to music can have a positive effect on a child's development.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...early exposure to a diverse range of bacteria...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A wide variety of different types of bacteria
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một loạt các vi khuẩn đa dạng

phase3Production.content: A healthy gut contains a diverse range of bacteria.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The readers of Yong’s book must be prepared for a decidedly unglamorous world.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'thế giới' (world) 'rõ ràng là' (decidedly) 'không hào nhoáng' (unglamorous)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A world that is certainly not attractive, exciting, or stylish
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một thế giới rõ ràng là không hào nhoáng

phase3Production.content: Garbage collection is a decidedly unglamorous but essential job.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Among the less appealing case studies is one about a fungus that is wiping out entire populations of frogs...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Quét sạch/xóa sổ' (wiping out) 'toàn bộ quần thể' (entire populations)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To destroy or eliminate a whole group of organisms completely
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Quét sạch toàn bộ quần thể

phase3Production.content: The disease is wiping out entire populations of bats in North America.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and can be halted by a rare microbial bacterium.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có thể 'bị chặn lại/ngăn chặn' (be halted by)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Can be stopped or brought to an end by something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có thể bị chặn lại bởi

phase3Production.content: The construction of the new road can be halted by protests from local residents.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Another is about squid that carry luminescent bacteria that protect them against predators.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Bacteria that produce and emit light

phase3Production.content: Deep-sea fish often have a symbiotic relationship with luminescent bacteria.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: However, if you can overcome your distaste for some of the investigations, the reasons for Yong’s enthusiasm become clear.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Vượt qua' (overcome) 'sự ghê tởm/không thích' (your distaste for) 'của bạn' (your)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To succeed in dealing with or controlling your feeling of dislike for something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vượt qua sự ghê tởm của bạn đối với

phase3Production.content: To become a doctor, you must overcome your distaste for blood.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The microbial world is a place of wonder.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A location or realm that inspires feelings of amazement and admiration
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một nơi của sự kỳ diệu

phase3Production.content: For a child, a toy store is a place of wonder.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Already, in an attempt to stop mosquitoes spreading dengue fever – a disease that infects 400 million people a year...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Transmitting the viral infection spread by mosquitoes
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lây lan bệnh sốt xuất huyết

phase3Production.content: Stagnant water is a breeding ground for mosquitoes that are responsible for spreading dengue fever.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...mosquitoes are being loaded with a bacterium to block the disease.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đang được 'nạp/cấy' (loaded with) 'một loại vi khuẩn' (a bacterium)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be filled or equipped with a bacterium
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được nạp/cấy một loại vi khuẩn

phase3Production.content: The genetically modified mosquitoes are loaded with a bacterium that makes them sterile.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a bacterium to block the disease.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To stop the transmission or progression of the illness

phase3Production.content: This new vaccine is designed to block the disease before symptoms appear.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In the future, our ability to manipulate microbes means we could construct buildings with useful microbes built into their walls...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To handle or control microorganisms in a skillful manner, often for a specific purpose

phase3Production.content: Scientists are learning how to manipulate microbes to produce biofuels.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with useful microbes built into their walls to fight off infections.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To resist or defend against illnesses caused by bacteria or viruses

phase3Production.content: A healthy immune system is essential to fight off infections.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Just imagine a neonatal hospital ward coated in a specially mixed cocktail of microbes...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A section of a hospital for newborn infants

phase3Production.content: The premature baby was taken to the neonatal hospital ward for special care.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: a specially mixed cocktail of microbes
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...coated in a specially mixed cocktail of microbes so that babies get the best start in life.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'hỗn hợp' (cocktail) 'vi khuẩn' (of microbes) 'được pha trộn' (mixed) 'đặc biệt' (specially)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A specific combination of different types of microbes prepared for a particular purpose
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một hỗn hợp vi khuẩn được pha trộn đặc biệt

phase3Production.content: The yogurt contains a specially mixed cocktail of microbes to improve gut health.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: get the best start in life
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...so that babies get the best start in life.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có 'sự khởi đầu' (start) 'tốt nhất' (the best) 'trong đời' (in life)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be given the best possible foundation and opportunities from the beginning of one's life
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có được sự khởi đầu tốt nhất trong đời

phase3Production.content: Good nutrition is essential for babies to get the best start in life.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Writing with lightness and panache, he has a knack of explaining complex science...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Viết với 'sự nhẹ nhàng' (lightness) và 'phong thái tự tin' (panache)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Writing in a style that is graceful, not too serious, and has a confident, stylish flair
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự nhẹ nhàng và phong thái

phase3Production.content: She hosted the awards ceremony with great lightness and panache.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we are continually swapping microbes with other humans...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Constantly exchanging one thing for another

phase3Production.content: The stock market is a dynamic environment where traders are continually swapping assets.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: At best, Yong informs us, we are only 50 per cent human.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Cùng lắm thì' (At best), chúng ta chỉ 50% là người

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Taking the most optimistic view; even in the most favorable of circumstances
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cùng lắm thì, trong trường hợp tốt nhất

phase3Production.content: The project will be completed by Friday at best.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...while the number of human cells in the average person is about 30 trillion, the number of microbial ones is higher – about 39 trillion.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Typically or usually; based on a calculation of the mean

phase3Production.content: On average, a person sleeps for about eight hours a night.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Yong’s book is in many ways a plea for microbial tolerance...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'lời kêu gọi/khẩn cầu' (a plea for)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An urgent and emotional request for something

phase3Production.content: The charity made a plea for donations to help the victims of the flood.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...pointing out that while fewer than one hundred species of bacteria bring disease...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To state or indicate a fact

phase3Production.content: He was quick to point out that the project was still under budget.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The book also acknowledges that our attitude towards bacteria is not a simple one.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To accept or admit the existence or truth of something

phase3Production.content: The report acknowledges that more research is needed.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...our attitude towards bacteria is not a simple one.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A settled way of thinking or feeling about someone or something

phase3Production.content: It's important to have a positive attitude towards learning.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Instead we should realise we have a symbiotic relationship, that can be mutually beneficial or mutually destructive.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Evil characters or good, admirable characters

phase3Production.content: In classic stories, the characters are often clearly defined as villains or heroes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...our unhealthy, low-fibre diets are disrupting the bacterial balance...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Eating plans that contain a small amount of fibre, a substance in plants that is important for digestion
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chế độ ăn ít chất xơ

phase3Production.content: Processed foods often contribute to unhealthy, low-fibre diets.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Among the less appealing case studies is one about a fungus...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A process or record of research in which detailed consideration is given to the development of a particular person, group, or situation over a period of time

phase3Production.content: The book includes several case studies of successful businesses.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the reasons for Yong’s enthusiasm become clear.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Lý do cho 'sự nhiệt tình/hào hứng' (enthusiasm) của Yong

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval

phase3Production.content: He spoke about his new project with great enthusiasm.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and can be halted by a rare microbial bacterium.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An uncommon type of microscopic single-celled organism

phase3Production.content: The infection was caused by a rare microbial bacterium that is resistant to most antibiotics.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Another is about squid that carry luminescent bacteria...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A sea animal with a long body, eight arms and two long tentacles

phase3Production.content: The giant squid is one of the most mysterious creatures of the deep sea.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that protect them against predators.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bảo vệ chúng khỏi 'những kẻ săn mồi' (predators)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Animals that naturally prey on others

phase3Production.content: Lions are apex predators at the top of the food chain.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...we could construct buildings with useful microbes built into their walls...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To build or erect structures such as houses or offices

phase3Production.content: They plan to construct new office buildings in the city center.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with useful microbes built into their walls to fight off infections.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'tích hợp vào' (built into) 'tường' (their walls) của chúng

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be incorporated as a permanent part of a structure

phase3Production.content: The new homes have smart technology built into their walls.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: For most of human history we had no idea that microbes existed.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trong 'hầu hết' (for most of) 'lịch sử loài người' (human history)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: During the largest part of the time that humans have existed
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong hầu hết lịch sử loài người

phase3Production.content: For most of human history, the average lifespan was less than 40 years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...was a Dutch lens-maker called Antony van Leeuwenhoek in the 1670s.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person who makes lenses for glasses, microscopes, or telescopes

phase3Production.content: The famous philosopher Spinoza was also a skilled lens-maker.
